title: Who is Terry Bates in EastEnders and why does Jay hate him?
text:
Terry has a lot to answer for… (Picture: BBC/Jack Barnes)

Terry Bates was a wrong ‘un on EastEnders, make no mistake.

The gangster might have shuffled off this mortal coil, but he’s still found a way to vex Jay Brown (Jamie Borthwick) from beyond the grave.

Here’s what happened between the mobster and Jay to make the latter hate the former so much…

Who is Terry Bates in EastEnders?

Terry Bates (Nicholas Ball) was the one responsible for the death of Jay’s father Jase Dyer (Stephen Lord) in 2008.

Jase and Terry had known each other since Jase was a teenager, with Terry taking Jase under his wing all those years ago.

When Jase came to Walford in 2007, after a stint in prison, he at first refused to work for the local gangster.

However, to ease his fiancee Dawn’s (Kara Tointon) financial woes, Jase ended up caving and taking work from Terry.

When Jase ended up owing Terry money, their relationship crumbled past the point of no return.

In tragic scenes, Terry and his brutish gang beat and stabbed Jase to death, while young Jay could only hide and listen on in a room nearby.

Terry eventually got his comeuppance however when he was sentenced to life behind bars for the crime and his wife subsequently left him.

In scenes tonight, Jay will be asked to help lay the mobster to rest.

Unsurprisingly, Jay will find the thought of helping his father’s murderer rest in piece pretty hard to swallow, and it will soon become clear that Jay has something up his sleeve when he agrees to take the job

With a recent trailer showing Jay standing over Terry’s corpse, promising to expose the horrible truth about the kind of man he really was in life, could Jay be tempting fate in the form of retribution from Terry’s gang?

EastEnders continues on Tuesday 22nd October at 7:30pm on BBC One.
